title: Pinnacle narrowly wins homecoming game 34-33
text:
Pinnacle narrowly wins homecoming game 34-33 Boulder Creek misses PAT to give Pinnacle the win Post to Facebook Pinnacle narrowly wins homecoming game 34-33 Boulder Creek misses PAT to give Pinnacle the win Check out this story on 12news.com: http://12ne.ws/1Rxb41b Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address.   Join the Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Pinnacle narrowly wins homecoming game 34-33 Elaine Wilson, 12 Sports 11:29 p.m. MST October 8, 2015 Pinnacle narrowly wins homecoming game KPNX Pinnacle narrowly pulls out a win against Boulder Creek, 34-33 (Photo: 12 Sports) CONNECT 4 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE As is the theme with Thursday night high school football, this was a close one. 
Though Pinnacle was the first on the board, Boulder Creek was the first to score a touchdown and instilled some fear in the Pioneers. The Pioneers held the momentum going into halftime, leading 24-13. 
But the second half was all Jaguars. 
Boulder Creek took a three-point lead, 27-24 late in the third quarter to put pressure on the Pioneer offense behind freshman quarterback Spencer Rattler. Pinnacle got two touchdowns, one accompanied by a two-point conversion to give the Pioneers a one-possession lead with six minutes on the clock. 
With just over a minute to play, Boulder Creek runningback Willie Muller got a touchdown, but the extra point was missed. The Pioneers took the victory formation on the next drive, but hung their heads on the sideline. 
Boulder Creek has yet to win a game this season, but quarterback Gunther Johnson thinks the tides can change next week. 
"Although we lost, it feels great how we played, and we're for sure going to carry that into next week. Next week we'll get our first 'W'." 
Boulder Creek (0-7) will face Horizon (0-6) next week, and Pinnacle (4-3) will face Centennial (4-2). Read or Share this story: http://12ne.ws/1Rxb41b TOP VIDEOS
